title: Ticket #6964: Fix mismatch between alloc()/delete found in #6876 code review
description: Memory allocation/deallocation mismatch : Many of the data members in file transfer, include the output destination, are allocated with strdup() (sigh) but then deallocated in the dtor with delete (instead of free). Seems like valgrind should have flagged this error years ago? Maybe in practice the compiler does not care since the data type is char * ?
remarks:
2019-Jul-11 12:31:03 by coatsworth:
This is fixed now, although I'm confused by Todd's comment. The char* OutputDestination that Brian added was indeed allocation with strdup() and then deallocated with delete, which is incorrect. I've changed this to free() now. However all the other FileTransfer data members that are being deallocated with delete are of StringList* type and are allocated using new so I thought this was the correct way to do it? Why would valgrind be upset?

I'm marking this as resolved and adding Todd + Brian to the notify list so they can see this comment. Also this doesn't need a version history entry.
